subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] For bruce:
author: Lisby
full_text:
That isn't his dad--it's Mike, his guide.

What you're hearing are artifacts of the sound clean-up program that  
makes the voices more audible.

These are not EVPs, they are realtime communication. They are heard  
out loud as they happen. That's what boxes do--they allow two-way  
real-time exchange between us and them.

Ann

On Jan 2, 2008, at 4:16 PM, DAna wrote:

> Now I am sure you arent aware of who I am being, noone else other
> than misty welcomed me to this group. Being I am not professional at
> e.v.p.s but yet have gone through listening to many of them from
> trustful resources, your e.v.p.s make me a bit leery. NOt trying to
> be rude, so dont go get all upset right off the bat. In your e.v.p.s,
> this one especially, alot of them sound like you, not the part where
> you asking questions, but where your dad is supposively answering
> you. NOw everyone has their own right to opinion so there is now need
> to get defensive, if all is real there would be nothing to get mad
> about. I just cant help but notice how odd it is that your e.v.p.
> questions to your father, seems to answer right away when you ask the
> question. Also, i notice that after you ask the question i hear
> something being turned on that has contains the answer to that
> question. Whether it be your dad or not. I feel its you that is
> answering, but let me tell you why i figure this.. and please you
> would like to defend you side of things that would be great, maybe i
> would be able to change my opinion on the matter. But as of now,
> e.v.p.s are usually done on the same tape that the questions are on,
> then in a rewind you can hear you and the e.v.p. but to me it sound
> like you put the e.v.p. response on another tape. i am not trying to
> start any kind of fight or be cruel, maybe i could learn something on
> behalf of how you do your work... thank you
>
>
>
